plugin.no_permission: You can contact the platform administrator to enable the plugins
plugin.cluster_missing: The cluster has not yet enabled the {0} plugins!
plugin.environment_missing: The {0} plugin has not been enabled for the cluster where the environment is located!

ruler.k8s_label: Does not conform to the Kubernetes label specification
ruler.k8s_annotation: Does not conform to the Kubernetes annotation specification
ruler.k8s_name: Does not conform to Kubernetes naming conventions
ruler.password: Error (includes uppercase and lowercase numeric special characters 8 to 16 passwords)

filter.placehold: Enter query criteria to filter result

breadcrumb.virtualspace: Virtual space is an aggregation of a set of environments.
breadcrumb.mesh_dag: Service mesh graph (DAG) is a graph of all load service mesh links under one or more namespaces.
breadcrumb.v_dashboard: Virtual space is an aggregation of a set of environments.
breadcrumb.v_workload: Workload is usually a carrier for accessing services and is an abstraction of a set of container groups (Pods).
breadcrumb.v_service: Service is a logical collection that defines a group of containers and a policy for accessing them.
breadcrumb.v_configmap: ConfigMap is often used to store configuration information required by a workload, and many applications read configuration information from configuration files, command-line arguments, or environment variables.
breadcrumb.v_authorization_policy: AuthenticationPolicies support access control to workloads in the grid.
breadcrumb.v_gateway: Gateway describes a load balancer running at the edge of the mesh to receive incoming or outgoing HTTP/TCP connections.
breadcrumb.v_peer_authentication: PeerAuthentication defines how traffic will be tunneled (or not) to the sidecar.
breadcrumb.v_service_entry: ServiceEntry allows adding additional entries to Istio's internal service registry so that auto-discovered services in the mesh can access/route to these manually specified services.
breadcrumb.v_sidecar: Sidecar describes the configuration of an agent that mediates inbound and outbound communication to the workload instance to which it is attached.
breadcrumb.appstore: HelmChart is a collection of files describing Kubernetes-related resources. A single application can be used to deploy some complex HTTP servers and web full-stack applications, databases, caches, etc.
breadcrumb.appstore_registry: The chart repository is where chart packages are stored, used by app stores and deployments.
breadcrumb.modelstore_registry: AI Model Registry achieves model synchronization by configuring the model warehouse, and is integrated in Kubegems.
breadcrumb.auth_setting: Based on the third-party authentication integration of oauth2.0/ldap, users can log in in various ways.
breadcrumb.prometheus_setting: Configure Prometheus Recording rules to improve monitoring query efficiency.
breadcrumb.monitor_template: Configure monitoring dashboard templates to quickly create monitoring dashboards.
breadcrumb.broadcast: Use banners and notifications to notify your users about scheduled maintenance and more.
breadcrumb.role: Description of all roles and operating permissions of the system.
breadcrumb.tenant: Tenant is a logical unit that organizes your projects and DevOps projects, manages access to resources, shares resources within a team, etc. It can be used as an independent workspace for team work.
breadcrumb.user: All users of the platform, including system administrators and ordinary members.
breadcrumb.audit: Audit queries for multi-dimensional operations such as project space, environment space, and resources.
breadcrumb.event: Event is provided by the container cloud event driver, which represents the state history of resources in the cluster.
breadcrumb.user_center: User Center provides user messages, auditing, personal settings, etc.
breadcrumb.dashboard: The container service under the tenant provides a work platform with security isolation and access control. Here you can see an overview of the resources running in the current tenant.
breadcrumb.project: Project is an abstract combination of a set of environments, applications, and image repositories.
breadcrumb.appmanifest: AppManifest is a collection of description files for a set of workloads, configurations, keys and other resources.
breadcrumb.registry: Registry is a repository (or collection of repositories) for storing container images for Kubernetes, DevOps, and container-based application development.
breadcrumb.cluster: Unified management of multiple clusters and the basic resources, service components and application resources of each cluster.
breadcrumb.plugin: Service plugin provides management of the health status and enabling status of each service component in the Kubernetes cluster.
breadcrumb.environment: Environment is the boundary of specific application, load, storage and other resources, usually a namespace.
breadcrumb.node: Node provides the running status of nodes under the current cluster.
breadcrumb.app: Application is the application runtime from application orchestration and application store deployment.
breadcrumb.deploy: Application Deployment provides a variety of application deployment methods, including rebuild, rolling update, blue-green, canary, etc.
breadcrumb.workload: Workload is usually a carrier for accessing services and is an abstraction of a set of container groups (Pods).
breadcrumb.pod: Pod is the basic unit of execution of a Kubernetes application, the smallest and simplest unit of the Kubernetes object model that you create or deploy.
breadcrumb.service: Service is a logical collection that defines a group of containers and a policy for accessing them.
breadcrumb.ingress: Ingress provides a way of aggregating services, you can expose the internal services of the cluster to the outside of the cluster through an externally accessible IP address.
breadcrumb.gateway: Gateway is used to forward the communication data of other servers.
breadcrumb.job: Job is responsible for batching short-lived one-off tasks, that is, tasks that are executed only once, and guarantees that one or more container groups of a batched task complete successfully.
breadcrumb.cronjob: CronJob manages time-based jobs, such as running only once at a given point in time, or periodically at a given point in time.
breadcrumb.configmap: ConfigMap is often used to store configuration information required by a workload, and many applications read configuration information from configuration files, command-line arguments, or environment variables.
breadcrumb.secret: Secret is a resource object that contains a small amount of sensitive information, such as passwords, tokens, secret keys, etc., stored in the form of key/value pairs and can be used in container groups.
breadcrumb.certmanager: Certificate, when creating a certificate, the certificate manager will create a corresponding CertificateRequest resource, which contains the encoded X.509 certificate request, issuer reference and other options based on the certificate resource specification.
breadcrumb.crd: CRD is an extension method for Kubernetes to implement custom resource types. Users can manipulate CRD objects in the same way as built-in resource objects.
breadcrumb.persistentvolumeclaim: PersistentVolumeClaim is used by user-created workloads and is a resource object that persists workload data.
breadcrumb.volumesnapshot: VolumeSnapshot represents a point-in-time copy of a storage volume. Snapshots can be used to provision new volumes (pre-populated with snapshot data) or to restore existing storage volumes to a previous state (represented by snapshots).
breadcrumb.storageclass: StorageClass is configured by the cluster administrator to configure the storage server parameters, and provides storage for cluster users according to the type.
breadcrumb.appconfig: Application Configuration can provide external dynamic configuration services to applications
breadcrumb.observe: Observability provides all functions such as log collection, viewing, alarm/monitoring indicator collection, alarm/alarm center, history/link tracking, etc.
breadcrumb.integrated: The Intergate Center allows you to configure application/middleware link tracking, metric monitoring, and logging for observability capabilities.
breadcrumb.dash_overview: Monitor Dashboard allows you to query and visualize your metrics.
breadcrumb.dash_metrics: Metrics allows you to query system monitoring metrics and generate related alarms.
breadcrumb.dash_log: Log is based on Loki's log viewing panel, which can perform log real-time query, snapshot, filtering, etc.
breadcrumb.dash_trace: Jaeger is an end-to-end distributed tracking monitoring system.
breadcrumb.alert_overview: Alert Dashboard allows you to view recent alert trends, summary and comparison of alert indicators.
breadcrumb.alert_history: Alert History allows you to view the history of alerts by condition.
breadcrumb.alert_blacklist: Alert Blacklist allows you to silence some alerts that you do not need to receive.
breadcrumb.config-monitor: The Monitor Config Center allows you to configure collectors, alarms, receivers and other monitoring indicators.
breadcrumb.log_monitor: The Log Config Center allows you to configure log collectors, alarms, receivers and other log metrics, as well as log flow filtering and other configurations.
breadcrumb.service_monitor: ServiceMonitor defines monitoring for a set of services, which is automatically discovered by Prometheus and becomes the target of its indicator pull.
breadcrumb.prometheus_rule: PrometheusRule are usually Prometheus alert rules set for monitoring indicators.
breadcrumb.flow: Flow/ClusterFlow defines a log flow with filters and outputs.
breadcrumb.output: Output/ClusterOutput defines the output to which your flow can send log messages.
breadcrumb.alert_channel: The alert channel provides a variety of alert message sending methods to notify users, including (email, Feishu, webhook, etc.)
breadcrumb.edge: A highly available and certified Kubernetes distribution designed for production workloads in unattended, resource-constrained, remote locations, or inside IoT devices.
breadcrumb.dash_probe: Prometheus probe is to monitor and analyze key performance indicators such as service loading speed, CDN acceleration, and DNS resolution.

tip.version: Version {0} has been released, please login again
tip.batch_delete_c: Please confirm the following resources that need to be {0}d!
tip.project_select: There is no environment under this project, please re-select the project or add an environment
tip.not_correct_yaml: It is not the correct K8S yaml format, please add the necessary fields or fill in the correct data format, the error message is:
tip.401: Authentication failed, please login to visit
tip.403: Not authorized to access this data
tip.404: The requested resource does not exist
tip.node_offline: The cluster has been disconnected, please select again
